intro: Helictotrichon schellianum, commonly known as Schell's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in early summer, producing blue to purple petals. Helictotrichon schellianum is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native range.
